page.title: 11Easter Holidays 1985.
page.content: In the Easter holidays,three families visited relatives in Scotland.One travelled by train,one by coach and the other by private car. Two boys,who are members of Henley Boys football team,travelled to Germany to participate in a football competition.They stayed with the families of members of German clubs. Two boys helped with the work on the farm which included feeding the calves, loading the trailer with hay bales, shifting dung and outside feeding. One family visited the Tower of London and Madame Tussaud's. Some boys helped their fathers to mow the lawns,water the plants in the greenhouse and sow grass seed. Several children went swimming and for bicycle rides.Visits to relatives resulted in horse riding and a great grandmother's 93rd birthday party.
